intro: Acourtia formosa, commonly known as the California goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of California and Baja California. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to coastal climates with mild winters and warm, dry summers. Acourtia formosa is often found in chaparral and coastal scrub habitats, where it thrives in full sun. Its distinctive appearance and ecological role make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
